vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/19804f6c-d2a4-48c7-b3cd-01bee52d79d6">VOCATIONAL EDUCATION CERTIFICATES</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/f1e0469b-4f5e-476f-a7e9-de267bfcde08">WEIGHT (PHYSIOLOGY)</keyword>         <topcClas>Childbearing, family planning and abortion - Health</topcClas>         <topcClas>General - Health</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social attitudes and behaviour - Society and culture</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The aims of the first <i>National Survey of Sexual Attitudes and Lifestyles</i> (NATSAL I) were to:<ul><li>aid understanding of the epidemiology of HIV and other sexually transmitted diseases</li><li>provide information to guide health education programmes for sexual health</li><li>provide input for models of HIV and AIDS</li></ul>The objectives of NATSAL I were to describe existing patterns and assess temporal changes in sexual behaviour in the general population, and to associate these with demographic characteristics and attitudes to different lifestyles and knowledge of possible associated risks. <br> <br> In order to preserve respondent confidentiality, the geographic ward variable has been removed from the data file and postcode sector (four digits) has been reduced to postcode district (three digits).  If ward or postcode sector level data are required, one of the four principal investigators should be contacted.<br> <br> A follow-up survey, <i>Discrimination Against Gay Men and Lesbians, 1993</i> is held at the UKDA under SN 3553. The two datasets may be linked via serial number.<br> <br> The second study in the NATSAL series, NATSAL II, was conducted in 2000 (see under SN 5223).<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Topics covered include: general health, family circumstances and learning about sex; past sexual history, including age at first heterosexual and homosexual experience, age at first intercourse and nature of the relationship and timing of  subsequent heterosexual experience; nature of current relationship and experience of marriage, cohabitation, divorce and separation; sexual orientation, prevalence and attitude towards different orientations; sexual practices, including past and current experience and frequency of sex; numbers and gender of sexual partners in different time periods; paying for sex (men only); sexual health, knowledge of AIDS and HIV, experience of infertility; abortion and miscarriage (women only); attendance at STD clinics, sources of advice, drug use and HIV antibody testing; risk reduction behaviour, perceived control of sexual health, knowledge and experience of safer sex practices, use of contraception; psychosocial factors influencing sexual behaviour such as source of information about sex (eg. family, friends and school) and attitudes towards different sexual lifestyles; demographic characteristics.<br> <br> <i>Standard Measures</i><br> Coding used: Occupation Code (OPCS, 1980); Socio-economic Group (OPCS, 1980); Standard Industrial Classification (OPCS, 1980).<br> Measurement scales: Attitude questions (Q.37-39) SCPR <i>British Social Attitudes</i> series.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="1990-05-01T00:00:00Z">May 1990</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="1991-11-01T00:00:00Z">November 1991</collDate>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <geogUnit>Health Authority Regions</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Postcode (District)</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Standard Statistical Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Adults</universe>         <universe>People between the ages of 16 and 59 years living in Great Britain south of the Caledonian Canal.</universe>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Repeated cross-sectional study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>First in series: the second study was conducted in 2000.</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>Social and Community Planning Research</dataCollector>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>20,000 (target); 18,876 (obtained). Weighted sample size: 18,876.</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview; Self-completion</collMode>         <sources />         <ConOps>Demographic characteristics of the sample compared with official statistics where possible.</ConOps>         <weight>Weighting factors used: Probability of selection within household (household size) and Region (to correct for variation in response).</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply.
